intro: Urostigma tsiela, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Urostigma tsiela is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, growing in sandy or rocky soils. It has been used traditionally in some African cultures for its medicinal properties.
